subject: What's New at Zoom | March 2024 Recap
body:
You don't often get email from customer-success-advisor@zoom.us. 
Learn why this is important
 
 
Dear Conner, 
 
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep you up to date, we have summarised some key new things you should know below. 
Download
 the latest version of the Zoom desktop client to access all these features and more. 
 
For more resources to help you stay up to date, check out: 
Preview notes
 
– A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
 
Release notes
 
– A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
 
 
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please reply directly to this email.
 
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers. 
Key Highlights from Zoom’s March Releases 
Zoom Web
 Updates 
Consolidated Meeting and Calendar tabs: Admin control - 
The Meetings and Calendar tabs are merging to provide the greater visibility of the calendar view with the meeting details needed for your daily tasks. Easily view and filter upcoming meetings, view the invitees and their responses, and review shared materials ahead of the session, while also reviewing previous meetings and their assets, such as recordings, continuous meeting chats, whiteboards, and more. This change will be rolled out to accounts over time and be controlled through a web setting available at the account, group, and user levels. Initially, Basic, Pro, and some smaller Business accounts will have this available with the March release, with this enabled by default for those Basic and Pro accounts. Other accounts can expect this in an upcoming release, which can be managed for eligible accounts through the 
Feature Release Controls
. 
AI-generated Virtual Backgrounds: Admin control -
 Generate a custom virtual background to suit your needs. Found within the virtual background selection window, eligible users can choose from preset options provided or enter a description of the virtual background they would like to generate. An AI-model will generate a few images to choose from, which can be immediately selected as your virtual background. Admins can control the use of this feature through account and group-level settings. This feature will be rolling out to accounts over the next few months. 
Zoom Phone
 Updates 
New member availability report - 
Account owners and admins can generate a member availability report to view real-time visibility into members' status and availability across call queues. This report shows each agent's Zoom client presence status and call status. Admins can also select a specific call queue to view a member's status. Please note, that the member aggregate number will be removed in the future to avoid confusion on available agents. Please, 
submit a request
 to Zoom Support to enable this feature for your account. 
Enhanced control and activation for mobile common area phones -
 Admins can now enable or disable in-call features such as call park, transfer to room, and transfer to carrier. The update also includes the ability to export QR codes in bulk, and selectable expiration dates for activation codes help simplify mobile Common Area Phone deployments. 
Zoom Events and Sessions
 Updates 
Introducing the session lite event type - 
Hosts can create a baseline webinar Zoom Event. This event type is a session lite event type, and it will have a minimalistic attendee experience that does not have a lobby, event detail page, moderation, ticketing, or event branding. Session lite events will only include a link to a registration form and a join link to the session. 
Enhancements to the Zoom Events Image Generation with AI Companion feature - 
In addition to the user's prompt, three recommended alternative prompts (based on the user's prompt) have been added to the Zoom Events Image Generation feature. Generated images that are inserted are added to the Zoom Events image library automatically. Hosts can also use the Image Generation feature for more areas in the event creation setup: Main Event Image, Session Image, Expo images, In-session branding (virtual background), and Production Studio. 
Customizable travel info tab for hybrid events -
 Hosts can add a customizable travel and accommodations tab to provide hybrid event attendees with helpful logistics such as embedded maps, airport/hotel directions, parking details, venue guidelines, and contact information. The tab content and visibility can be customized, allowing hosts to share targeted information with in-person attendees. This aims to simplify travel planning so attendees can easily get to the event venue. 
Zoom Contact Center
 Updates 
Admin controls for AI Companion for Contact Center - Account
 owners and admins can enable or disable specific AI companion features like Sentiment Analysis, Engagement Summary, Follow Up Tasks, and Talk Metrics. This allows admins to customize which AI features are exposed to agents based on their preferences. These settings can be controlled at the account and queue levels. 
AI-powered live engagement monitoring for agents - 
AI Companion for Contact Center introduces new capabilities to help supervisors monitor and assist agents during live engagements. Supervisors can view real-time consumer sentiment, see live transcripts, and automatically generated conversation summaries to get quick insights. The UI is also enhanced to simplify common supervisor actions like listening in and recording engagements. These AI-powered features help supervisors to effectively monitor agent interactions and assist agents when needed. 
Interactive surveys for consumers - 
Admins can link surveys to messaging queues and flows to collect feedback from consumers. At the end of a chat, consumers are prompted to take the survey in-chat or later via a web link. The in-chat survey allows consumers to respond to rating scale, multiple choice, and free response questions within the chat window. It provides a seamless way for consumers to give feedback without disrupting the chat experience. This feature enables admins to gather targeted feedback to improve consumer satisfaction. 
Zoom Revenue Accelerator
 Updates 
Support streamlined notification management: Admin control - 
Zoom Revenue Accelerator admins can efficiently modify and manage all their Zoom Revenue Accelerator related notifications, whether email or in-product, using a centralized control hub. This functionality is accessible through the Notification Settings and, if enabled, allows users to conveniently adjust their notification settings on their personal settings page. This setting is available at the account and user level. This feature may not be immediately available as it is dependent on a web release. 
Support for additional transcript language: Arabic -
 Language support for multilingual transcription is expanding to include Arabic. The newly supported language is currently in beta. Conversation metrics, Screen Text, and Call Outs, such as Indicators, Next Steps, and Good Questions, are currently supported in beta for this additional language. 
Workspace Reservation
 Updates 
Introducing Wayfinding -
 Account owners and admins can set up wayfinding to guide users from the office entrance to their desks or meeting rooms. Users can view directions on their mobile devices, desktop app, and kiosks. 
Automatically check users into workspace reservations when connecting to office WiFi - 
Account owners and admins can enable a setting to automatically check users into their workspace reservation when their Zoom client detects they have connected to the office WiFi. This allows account owners and admins to more accurately track workspace utilization without users needing to remember to manually check-in. This setting requires account owners and admins to configure the office WiFi details at each location so Zoom clients can detect when a user is connected. When enabled, users will receive an alert when they are automatically checked in upon connecting to the office WiFi. 
Zoom Whiteboard
 Updates 
Support for Whiteboard Projects in tablet and mobile -
 Users can now access and create Whiteboard Projects in tablet and mobile apps without joining a meeting. This allows users to contribute to specific projects, access shared content, and maintain organized workflows. The addition of mobile and tablet support makes whiteboard collaboration more flexible, enhancing productivity across devices. 
Zoom Virtual Agent
 Updates
Support for knowledge base AI-generated queries - 
Zoom Virtual Agent admins can opt in to AI-generated queries to help jump start knowledge base coaching. This feature leverages AI to generate queries based on knowledge base content. This allows knowledge base admins to efficiently train the system to align with specific company content. It is recommended that admins select the most frequently used articles to optimize efficiency. Once selected, admins can review the AI-generated queries and the best answers recommended by the model, change to a new answer, delete, or coach.  
Enhancements to video URL functionality in bot flows - 
Admins can easily embed video in bot flows by entering a URL, rather than needing to download and upload a file. For supported sites like YouTube, Vimeo, and Dailymotion, the video title and thumbnail are automatically populated. Admins can override the title if needed. For other sites, admins can manually enter a title and upload a thumbnail image. Users can play the videos directly within the chat . This enhancement simplifies the process of adding engaging video content to bot flows. 
Service Announcements 
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy - 
We plan to enforce the next round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on May 4, 2024, for all products and services, starting with the minimum versions referenced in the table found 
here
. Users running an end-of-life version after May 4 will not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client and will be prompted to update or join from the Web browser. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom desktop client or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features.  
 
Happy Zooming,
Zoom Success Advisor
 
 
You're receiving this email because you are a Zoom customer.
If you wish to be removed from our email list, 
unsubscribe
 or 
manage your email preferences.

subject: 48% of women of color have experienced racism in their current workplace. What can we do?
body:
We'll give you practical strategies for navigating racially charged situations and for creating equitable workplaces for women of color 
 
The facts exist. Women of color are experiencing racism at work.
 
48% of women from marginalized racial and ethnic groups in the US have experienced racism in their current workplace, according to a 2023 study from Catalyst. Breaking it down by race and/or ethnicity, it looks like this:
53% of African American, Black, and/or Afro-Diasporic women
50% of Hispanic and/or Latina women
48% of Indigenous, Native American, and/or American Indian women
45% of Asian, South Asian, Native Hawaiian, and/or Pacific Islander women 
Women of color in their workplaces are forced to navigate a different landscape with unique challenges of racism, microaggressions, biases, and codeswitching to mask parts of their identity to "fit in" at work.
 
These personal and professional challenges create the "concrete ceiling" for women of color in the workforce.
 So, what can we do to create equitable workplaces that allow women of color to succeed and thrive? 
 
We're hosting a number of conversations on this very topic April 23-25, exploring things like the allyship gap between white and Black women in the workplace, the dissonance between how women of color are perceived and their aspirational professional image, practical strategies for navigating racially charged situations at work, tools for career- and self-development for women of color, even how we can overcome obstacles to success in global environments. More details on these sessions are below and 
on our website here
!
 
A number of our nearly 90 sessions at the virtual Racial Justice at Work Summit: Justice for All will focus on building equitable and empowering workplaces for women of color. 
Join The Winters Group team, 80+ DEI speaker and experts, and hundreds of fellow advocates from around the world at this summit here!
Register to Attend the Racial Justice at Work Summit
 
The 'Concrete Ceiling': Working Towards More Equitable Futures for Women of Colour 
with Hanieh Khosroshahi and Dr. Zahra Khosroshahi
Global Perspectives: Empowering Black Women of the Diaspora
 with Dewbien Plummer, Aminata Conteh-Biger, and Cherine Haynes
The Allyship Gap: Black and White Women in Real Partnership for Change 
with Jennifer Brown and Adrienne Lawrence
Black Women: Calculating the Cost of Liberation
 with Tamara Winfrey-Harris
Black Women in Leadership - Understanding
 with Movell Dash
Taking Care of Black Girls
 with Ariana Brown
Register to Attend the Racial Justice at Work Summit
 
Thank you to the sponsors of the Racial Justice at Work Summit:
 Merck, Under Armour, Tapestry, Bank of America, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Minnesota, Cushman & Wakefield, Mount Sinai, Amazon, Kaiser Permanente, H&M, Town & Country Markets, Piper Sandler, and IDI, LLC

"
It feels so good to know I'm not alone
." This is the sentiment we hear time and time again from new graduates of the 
Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM™)
 program.
The CPTM program is Training Industry's flagship course for emerging and existing learning and development (L&D) professionals, but it is so much more than a certification. It's also an invitation to join an
 always growing, international community of L&D leaders.
Regardless of your industry or where you are in your career path, the 
CPTM alumni community
 is a place for you to find your people. It's where you can share your struggles and successes and let your passion for better training solutions thrive. Being a part of this community affords you opportunities to share your thought leadership, get inspired by new ideas from exclusive networking opportunities and to connect with other professionals dedicated to driving real impact and innovation through L&D.
The CPTM alumni community is waiting to welcome you. Click below to learn more about the CPTM program, and to download the course brochure.
Learn More
 
Download the Brochure
"The CPTM program has provided me not only the tools but the confidence to drive my professional growth as a training manager, and deliver my company with positive results, increasing the awareness on properly designed and business aligned training programs. Additionally I have become part of a 
community of professionals
 that share and support each other's growth!"
— Igor Torrealba, Global Learning and Development Specialist, Aptiv, Poland

subject: The Secret to Better Performance Reviews
body:
Find out what you need to evaluate employee skills.
View this email in your browser
.
EVALUATE YOUR
EMPLOYEE
PERFORMANCE
View the Brochure
Learn More
Whether your company uses an annual or continuous performance review and feedback process, it's critical to have a rubric to effectively and fairly measure your workers' performance against. Competency models provide the foundation for performance reviews by identifying the exact skills and abilities required in a job role and defining performance expectations for each, giving you a roadmap for how to evaluate employee performance and development needs in that role.
Being able to create new, custom competency models or improve competency models that your business has been using for years can easily feel overwhelming. Training Industry Courses' 
Competency Modeling Certificate
 program was created to help learning leaders, like you, learn how to create these models and identify key competencies, write competency definitions, discover skills gaps and gain buy-in among stakeholders.
Ready to get started? Click below to view the brochure and to learn more about this certificate program.
View the Brochure
 
Learn More
 
"Useful course if you're headed towards Competency Modeling and don't know where to start. The course was enhanced by the expertise of the facilitator and the participation of my peers.”
— Erin Hayes, Senior Manager, Learning, Haventree Bank

subject: Learn how Bravely Boost™ develops employees at all skill levels
body:
It’s the perfect solution for coaching at scale.
 
Develop everyone with Bravely Boost™
Your organization’s success hinges on the productivity and well-being of your ICs and managers as they face the day-to-day challenges of their roles.
 
Bravely Boost™, our on-demand coaching solution, was designed to develop and support employees at scale—from individual cohorts to full populations. 
LEARN MORE
 
 
With Bravely Boost™, employees get access to: 
 
 
On-demand, professional coaching
Our coaches sessions are available in over 30 languages and on the employee’s schedule—during the workday, at night, and even on weekends.
 
 
Exclusive monthly webinars
Each month, we have live, interactive webinars exclusively for Bravely users—and led by our professional coaches—to help them build the skills they need to be successful at work. 
 
 
Content library
All users with access to Bravely receive access to an extensive library of articles and webinar recordings for self-led employee development. 
 
Schedule a demo to find out how Bravely can develop and support your ICs and managers! 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
 
 
Bravely, 2578 Broadway, Suite 542, New York, NY 10025

subject: [ROADSHOW] Unlock Government Innovation with Google Public Sector's GenAI
body:
You don't often get email from will.judy@m.carahsoft.com. 
Learn why this is important
Join us to explore the cutting-edge world of GenAI with hands-on labs, expert-led sessions, and more! 
Click here 
to view this message in a browser window 
 
Google Public Sector GenAI on 
Google Cloud and Google Workspace
 
 
 
Thursday, May 9, 2024
 
 
8:30am - 5:00pm CT
 
Google Chicago Office
320 N Morgan St
Chicago, IL 60607
Register Now
 
Generative AI (GenAI) is a groundbreaking form of artificial intelligence that empowers humans to create content seamlessly. This technology marks a new frontier in government work and engagement, unlocking unprecedented levels of productivity, collaboration, and creative expression. GenAI's potential to reshape how governments operate is immense – imagine automating up to 70% of routine employee tasks, and making it easier for citizens to engage with government services.
 
Join Google Public Sector and Carahsoft
 for this full-day, onsite workshop where you will learn about Google's secure, GenAI capabilities and LLMs, prompt design, and much more in this lecture and hands-on labs format. You will get to experience first-hand the power of Gemini for Workspace, Gemini for AppSheet, Vertex AI Search, Vertex AI Conversation, and more.
